docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.abstract: In this lesson, students learn about the changing public perception of cigarettes over the century. They then create a visual timeline for classroom display, and design a survey on people's views on cigarette smoking for homework.
docs.snippet: In this lesson, students learn about the changing public perception of cigarettes over the century. They then create a visual timeline for classroom display, and design a survey on people's views on cigarette smoking for homework.

docs.lead_paragraph: California's stem cell agency announced Friday that it would give out about $75 million in research grants to a dozen universities and nonprofit laboratories, a month after distributing $45 million for studies. Some of the money will go to researchers looking for ways to fight Alzheimer's, Parkinson's and Lou Gehrig's diseases and to grow nerve and liver cells.

headline.main: State Awards More Stem Cell Grants
